content:
Yes, there are many Korean celebrities who have been promoting a wellness and self-care lifestyle recently. Here are a few examples:

1. IU - IU is a popular singer and actress who is known for promoting a healthy lifestyle. She has been open about her struggles with eating disorders in the past and now advocates for a balanced and healthy diet. She is also a avid yoga practitioner and often shares videos of herself doing yoga on social media.

2. Park Shin Hye - Park Shin Hye is an actress who promotes various forms of physical exercise and promotes body positivity. She has participated in charity walks and runs, and is an ambassador for the Korean National Parks Service where she frequently shares her love for hiking.

3. G-Dragon - G-Dragon is a popular Korean rapper and fashion icon who also promotes healthy living. He is known for his intense workout routines, which he has shared on social media. He is also an advocate for mental health and has encouraged fans to seek professional help when needed.

4. Tiffany Young - Tiffany is a Korean-American singer who is known for promoting self-love and confidence. She is a spokesperson for the American skincare brand Origins and promotes clean and healthy skin care routines.

These celebrities are just a few examples of the growing trend in Korea towards promoting wellness and self-care, which includes not just physical health but also mental and emotional well-being.
